documents.document: Jealous!! I want to live here! A friend of mine has a shower-drain frog. I want one too, not fair :( https://t.co/Pw6RwfIz7C
@TititiPounamu which has practical uses in agriculture and horticulture, bringing you food free of insect nibbling #actuallivingscientist
I'm Robyn, an #actuallivingscientist studying plant and insect communication through semiochemicals and pheromones
I'm Robyn, an #actuallivingscientist I used to study NZ native birds response to novel predators
!!! I love them! https://t.co/dnGrO6CQhl
I had a dream that my #nzsecretsanta present arrived, and I was on a boat and my Santa personally scuba dived it to me #willitevercome?

@e_scheltema Unfortunately most of the insects I come across are dead/dying and coverered in glue on my sticky bases
@e_scheltema I want to try get as many real insects photo'd on their card! Maybe we should start a Twitter collaboration with other buyers
@AFProbert once I found a bag of toys, magazines, dvds and a penis enlarger during field work in the bush. So funny yet disturbing
@ABSAbirds I was scared of the kingfisher we caught, but he was very docile. I'd only handled nice, friendly NZ passerines before this trip!
Smug crested shrike tit with it's amazingly powerful beak @ABSAbirds https://t.co/wDsN7h8rlH
@ABSAbirds & it was bycatch, so not worth it!!! (well, except for the good story)
@ABSAbirds it had such a flexible neck, one person had to try hold while the other extracted & we both still got maimed.
Crested Shrike Tit injuries @ABSAbirds there were torn off bits of skin in it's beak. I'm used to friendly NZ birds https://t.co/lTmt9KXQyE
Ahhh I once rescued one of these from a mistnet WITHOUT gloves, a very painful experience! https://t.co/gShudhcZBQ
Got the shivers watching this, how beautiful, I want to go there! https://t.co/EKhETzICvr
